abstract: Warren Buffett may have fallen into one of the biggest mutual fund traps of all — forgetting how incentives affect fund managers’ behavior.
snippet: Warren Buffett may have fallen into one of the biggest mutual fund traps of all — forgetting how incentives affect fund managers’ behavior.
lead_paragraph: A number of years ago, in a moment of professional weakness, I bought exactly one share of Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (the Class B share, mind you, not the $100,000 kind). For a brief moment, I thought his track record might disprove the economist’s mantra that no one can beat the market in the long term so it’s better to just invest in index funds like one that matches the S.& P. 500.
